wikipedia_page.main: Frank Tobin CBE was  a rugby union international who represented England in the first international rugby match in 1871.

response: * Frank Tobin, rugby union international who represented England in the first international rugby match in 1871.

link_mentions.page: List of England national rugby union players
1871 Scotland versus England rugby union match
response: England: A. G. Guillemard (West Kent), Richard Osborne (Manchester), Arthur Lyon (Liverpool), William MacLaren (Manchester), John Edmund Bentley (Gipsies), Frank Tobin (Liverpool), JF Green (West Kent), Reg Birkett (Clapham Rovers), Benjamin Burns  (Blackheath), JH Clayton (Liverpool), Charles Arthur Crompton (Blackheath), Alfred Davenport (Ravenscourt Park), JM Dugdale (Ravenscourt Park), AS Gibson (Manchester), Alfred St. George Hamersley (Marlborough Nomads), John Luscombe (Gipsies), Charles Sherrard (Blackheath), Frederick Stokes (Blackheath) (capt.), DP Turner (Richmond), H.J.C. Turner (Manchester)
*Dennis Tobin, English rugby league footballer who played in the 1950s, brother of Frank Tobin (rugby league) (unrelated to Frank Tobin (rugby union))
*Frank Tobin (rugby league), coach/physiotherapist/trainer for Widnes, brother of Dennis Tobin (unrelated to Frank Tobin (rugby union))
*Frank Tobin, English rugby union footballer who played in the 1860s and 1870s
